Pre-Game Insights: West Indies aim for solid start against Papua New Guinea in the opening match of the ICC Twenty20 World Cup 2024
Darren Sammy as coach for West Indies
Nicolas Pooran will play a pivotal role in the middle-order for West Indies
West Indies boast additional firepower with Powell, Andre Russell, Shimron Hetmyer, Sherfane Rutherford, and Romario Shepherd
Papua New Guinea will make their second appearance after 2021
Assadollah Vala-led PNG will have 10 players from their 2021 campaign, with that edition's reserve member Jack Gardner picked in the 15-player group this time
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match starts at 8 pm IST
Others: USA to face Canada in the second match of the day
USA coached by former Australian batter Stuart Law
USA have proved that they will be no pushovers, having beaten the full-member side Bangladesh 2-1 in the build up to the tournament
The USA have the edge having beaten Canada 4-0 recently
The USA team will be boosted by former New Zealand player and 2015 World Cup finalist Corey Anderson
Monank Patel will lead the USA team
The USA team will also feature some familiar names in former Mumbai and Rajasthan Royals left-arm spinner Harmeet Singh and ex-Delhi and Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Milind Kumar
They also have Saurabh Netravalkar, the most capped USA player, Aaron Jones, and opener Steven Taylor, their highest run-scorer in international cricket
Tearaway quick Ali Khan is also fit for the tournament, shaking off a hamstring injury which kept him out of the Canada series
Batting all-rounder Nitish Kumar, who played 18 T20Is for Canada from 2012 to 2019, has now switched sides and will be seen in the USA jersey
Left-arm orthodox spinner Saad Bin Zafar brings a wealth of experience to the Canada team
Top-order batter Aaron Johnson and left-arm seamer Kaleem Sana also expected to feature heavily in a side with just four players under the age of 30
